Interface GameLevel

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClassicLevel, DynamicLevel, Level1, Level2, Level3
public interface GameLevel
Defines the characteristics of a game level in Tetris. Each level can have different speed settings, special mechanics, and gameplay modifiers.

Implementations can customize:

  • Game speed (tick interval)
  • Rotation limits
  • Garbage row mechanics
  • Visual effects (flickering)
  • UI modifications (hidden next brick)
  • Control modifications (inverted controls)
See Also:
  • ClassicLevel
  • Level1
  • Level2
  • Level3

  • Method Details

    • getTickInterval

      javafx.util.Duration getTickInterval(int currentScore)
      Gets the tick interval (time between automatic brick drops). Can vary based on the current score for progressive difficulty.
      Parameters:
      currentScore - the player's current score
      Returns:
      the duration between game ticks

    • getName

      String getName()
      Gets the display name of this level.
      Returns:
      the level name

    • getRotationLimit

      default int getRotationLimit()
      Gets the maximum number of rotations allowed per brick.
      Returns:
      the rotation limit, or -1 for unlimited

    • isGarbageEnabled

      default boolean isGarbageEnabled()
      Checks if garbage rows should be added during gameplay.
      Returns:
      true if garbage mechanics are enabled

    • isFlickerEnabled

      default boolean isFlickerEnabled()
      Checks if screen flickering effects are enabled.
      Returns:
      true if flicker effects should be shown

    • isNextBrickHidden

      default boolean isNextBrickHidden()
      Checks if the next brick preview should be hidden.
      Returns:
      true if next brick preview is hidden

    • areControlsInverted

      default boolean areControlsInverted()
      Checks if horizontal controls are inverted.
      Returns:
      true if left/right controls are swapped
